name: Bilateral Acute Retinal Pigment Epitheliopathy (BARPE)
chief_complaint: I've been seeing dark spots in both eyes for the past week, and my vision seems blurry in bright light.
symptoms: reduced visual acuity in bright light
physical_findings: multifocal yellow-white lesions at the level of RPE

lab_results.FA (Fluorescein Angiography): early hypofluorescence with late staining of lesions
lab_results.OCT (Optical Coherence Tomography): disruption of ellipsoid zone and RPE thickening

prognosis: Guarded; 60% recover near-normal vision within 3-6 months, but 40% develop permanent paracentral scotomas
description: BARPE is a rare, idiopathic inflammatory condition affecting the retinal pigment epithelium. It presents with acute-onset bilateral visual disturbances, often following a viral illness. The pathophysiology involves transient dysfunction of the RPE pump mechanism, leading to fluid accumulation and photoreceptor disruption. Differential includes MEWDS, APMPPE, and syphilitic uveitis.
multiple_choice: Acute Posterior Multifocal Placoid Pigment Epitheliopathy (APMPPE)
